TopicTitle: WW2 BAD-T 2 - BDA AI Dogfight Tournament [SEMIFINALS]

Articles.Content:
Talk about a hair raising experience ... You think a plane is gonna bite it and it just keeps going and going

It was basically a fight with one pair having too much yaw authority and the other pair having too little

The next combat will be : "the first to be out of fuel will loose" !

The AI is a little random too - it's not just a case of bad AI setup, it's decision making is still rather suspect, there's nothing much you can do about that with design other than set up to avoid fighting. It'll improve over time, it's just not an easy thing to perfect at all, so no surprise it's frustrating at times.

A baseline combat dummy or two wouldn't hurt anyone at all though - also a baseline combat arena.

When I was tweaking my plane, in addition to an improved dummy I also created a small (.625) and rather nimble unarmed drone to improve my aim.

I think it helped, but AI tweaking is a lot about feeling - it's hard to measure whether what you're doing is helping. I guess we'll see in one of the future battles :-)

2 hours ago, DoctorDavinci said:

Depending on the setup of control surfaces in combination with the AI pilot settings, I discovered that I could totally change the way the Bad Company engaged targets

Yes, it does some neat stuff if it sees it can't get it's nose back on  the target ( sometimes it just climbs away even if it could, which ends up with another dangerous head-on pass ) - but some of the decision making depends on the *other* plane, so you can't cover everything. There's also not a lot you can do about "turn away - climb - reduce throttle - ignore incoming shells", or flying all the way to one target before turning round & flying back to the other, or the pilot's occasional desire to just fly straight which was something that drove me mad in previous BDAs. All that will be worked out eventually, I don't really envy the guys working on it though

Took me a good 3 weeks of tweaking the Bad Company to see how she responds to slight changes in settings (both AI Pilot and control surface settings).

Learning how FAR works has been an experience and a half ... I thought I had a good grasp of aerodynamics but have learned so much just from screwin' around in Kerbal.

By the way, uploading at least one battle tonight!

And I actually rocked that test despite not finishing a single exercise, it was THAT hard.
Fantastic that you rocked the test ... Really excited to see more of the BAD-T2 competition
